intro: Alamania, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, many of which are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers. The plants typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Alamania species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
